messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1353
messages.msgSnippet: You can get a mild case of chickenpox that doesn t show more than a really mild rash.  Sometimes mistaken for a heat rash.  Also, some folks get no rash at
messages.messageBody:
You can get a mild case of chickenpox that doesn't show more than a really
mild rash. Sometimes mistaken for a heat rash. Also, some folks get no
rash at all. Not the norm, but it happens.

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: <RValvo7626@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>

the

he

>
> NICKI~

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1353
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/9/01 3:05:56 PM Mountain Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/9/01 3:05:56 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Your information on shingles is not correct. In fact, it would appear to
be
the reverse. >>


I always thought people who got shingles were those who did not have the
chicken pox. My stepbrother had shingles in his late teens and I was told he
had never had chickenpox.

NICKI~
